question.text:
Read the statements given below. Identify which of them are true and which of them are false. Select the correct option after referring to the table.

I. Malaria is caused by a protozoan known as Plasmodium.
II. Plasmodium vivax malaria is the most serious one and can be fatal.
III. Plasmodium enters the female body by the bite of the female Anopheles mosquito.
IV. The parasites initially attack the liver cells and then multiply in the WBCs causing their rupture.

solution.text: Malaria is a vector-borne disease caused by a protozoan Plasmodium. There are four species of Plasmodium. The malaria caused by Plasmodium falciparum is the most serious and can be fatal. Plasmodium enters the female body by the bite of female Anopheles mosquito. The parasites initially attack the liver cells and then multiply in the red blood cells causing their rupture.
